The Sweetest Boy Ever

girl:
I love you.

- Boy:
Yeah I know everyone does!

-Girl:
Really?

- Boy:
Yeah...everyone of my friends that are girls tell me that everyday.

- Girl:
Oh...but am I only your friend?

- Boy:
No...you're my girlfriend...why?

- Girl:
So when I say I love you I really do mean it.

- Boy:
Yeah I know you do mean it...its just that you dont need to tell me that you love me anymore cuz I know you love me since the day we been together and i love you more each and everyday.

- Girl:
......

- Boy:
So wanna go somewhere tonight for our 7th anniversary?

- Girl:
Yeah...where?

- Boy:
I dont know...maybe movie then dinner?

-Girl:
Ok.

- Boy:
Ill pick you up after I get off and get ready ok?

- Girl:
Ok. What time do you get off?

- Boy:
In 2 hours and then I gotta go home and yeah get ready which takes about 15-20 mintues...

-Girl:
hey...I thought you didnt have work today...

- Boy:
One of my co-workers called in sick.

- Girl:
Oh okay! So ill see you around 7:30 then?

- Boy:
Yeah! and babe?

- Girl:
Yeah?

- Boy:
I love you.

- Girl:
I love you too!

- Boy:
Ok my manager is like looking at me so yeah.... i gotta go.

- Girl:
Ok bye.

- Boy:
Bye.

****************************

2 hours later...

The guy drives to his girlfriends house and walks up to the door and rings bell.

- Girl:
Hey! (gives a kiss to her boyfriend)

- Boy:
Wassup...you ready?

- Girl:
Um...wait...let me get my bag and we can go ok?

- Boy:
Ok.

They both watched a movie and ate dinner...once they were done eating they head back to the car but before she got into the car...

- Boy:
Wait! Can I blind fold you?

- Girl:
Why??!

- Boy:
Its a suprise.

- Girl:
What kind of suprise?

- Boy:
A big one.

- Girl:
Okay but only if you promise me that you will hold my hand while we're driving.

- Boy:
I promise.

- Girl:
Ok blind fold me...

So they drove off...........and then they stoped.

- Boy:
Ok we're here!

-Girl:
Where?

- Boy:
Wait let me walk you to the place!

- Girl:
What place?

- Boy:
Somewhere! (and gives a kiss to her on the lips)

- Girl:
Baby!...

The boy walks her to the place.

- Boy:
Ok...let me take the blind fold off.

- Girl:
Where are we?

He takes it off her and she opens her eyes and sees the view of the city and at that same spot...that's where he first asked her to be his girlfriend....

- Girl:
Omg...(tears come down)

- Boy:
Why are you crying?

- Girl:
This is where you first asked me out...

- Boy:
What are you doing the rest of your life? (he asked on his knees and after he says that...behind him...in the air it says "Will you marry me?" in fireworks)

- Girl:
(tears come down faster)

- Boy:
I wasnt at work when you called me...I was planning this whole thing!

- Girl:
Get up!

- Boy:
Yeah?

- Girl:
(kisses him)

- Boy:
Is that a yes or a no?

- Girl:
Yes.

unlock the door

Thoughts

I started writing this already, but i copied it then got distracted and copied something else. *sighs* I haven't the mind to try re-writing it so...meh.

Nervous. This isn't quite like journal. I've spent hours coming back to this window - but my attension has been elsewhere. Friends with problems needing advice and support. The story of my life. Some say I should be a counsellor rather than an editor. Spend so much time working out problems. But friends are friends and they would (and have) done the same for me.

*sighs*

I'm back at my parent's for a couple of weeks. A short escape from the insanity that Sydney causes. Although, in a way, I miss it.
Here is good for some things and not others. It makes it easier - money wise, etc. But does little for my state of mind and emotions. Its funny, when im here I want to be in Sydney but when I'm in Sydney I want to be here. I think it's mainly the seperation that bothers me, yet nothing can be done about it.

There are still shadows of my former self and they linger here.

Merry Christmas

Christmas Eve
A day of dreams
Of coming magic
For all the children.
A night of loneliness
A night of sadness

I'm too old now

Its been awhile

That’s right

An artist

A picture speaks a thousand words
A writer sees the picture and tries to find the right thousand words

To show it to every one

I once found my artist, he may not have known it
But the life inside the picture was a brilliant place

Sadly, as much art does, it faded away
It remains buried back in someone’s mind

Waiting to be rediscovered

Until then, there are only the dreams

It is an interesting experience

Watching someone dream

To see their eyes move beneath the skin and know

Their subconscious mind is speaking right before you

Yet you cannot, and most likely will not, ever see what they saw

To know that what they see feels real when you know it’s not

Each dream has its own story
Whether created via emotion or influenced by imitations of life
Something can always be made of it
There is so much I see, so much that sparks that feeling
The urge to pour out these thoughts

There are so many images that pass through my head

I just need an artist

To make them as real for you as they are for me

I'm sorry in a way. I've been feeling gloomy for awhile now. The sinking, drowning, numb feeling has filled me once again. I guess this is why I was unsure about coming back here. Everything tends to fall away, leaving me staring at the wall crying with no real reason for anything. The world is always ending here, and the stress doesn't help me. It's funny, I don't dream at all in Sydney but here I do nothing but watch dream after dream play before my eyes. I talked to Leish for awhile tonight, and that made me feel a little better. We are going to catch up on Friday, and she says she'll even write me a letter for old times sake. I should write her one as well. But there are many people to write to, and currently i don't feel up to it. There are things to tell Alex, cause she understands where no one else really seems to. Hopefully she can sort my head out.

And yes, I still ramble about seemingly unrelated things. I promise it makes sense in my head.... *sighs* I really should go to bed, yet part of me is fighting the urge to sleep just to stay a little bit longer.

I don't see how it will make any difference. Even if what i am waiting for happens, I still would be stuck at the same point i am now - what to say?

Considering things are starting to become surreal and blurring as my eyes try to shut down, I better go.

Good night all.

~love~
